title.narrative: 3.4: PUBLIC FINANCE MANAGEMENT AND PLANNING AT ALL LEVELS ENHANCED

description.narrative: 3.4: Public finance management and planning at all levels is enhanced, especially to support delivery of integrated and convergent social services for girls and boys (0â€“18 years), managed by provincial governments and municipal administrations especially in targeted, deprived areas., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Strengthening capacities for decentralized convergent social services

related-activity.ref: 6810/A0/07/883 STRENGTHENING CAPACITIES FOR DECENTRALIZED CONVERGENT SOCIAL SERVICES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.4: Public finance management and planning at all levels is enhanced, especially to support delivery of integrated andconvergent social services for girls and boys (0?18 years), managed by provincial governments and municipal administrationsespecially in targeted, deprived areas.

description.narrative: Public finance planning is enhanced, with UNICEF support, at both central and municipal levels for the delivery of social services for children. At central level, child-sensitive cash transfers are included in the state budget for the very first time. At municipal level, six administrations have planned and budgeted for intersectoral social services delivery.The partnership with the Ministry of Finance is strengthened, leading to increased budget literacy amongst the population and paving the way for participatory budgeting and better public finance management. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2022
